Description: Rim and wall fragment of Attic red-figured pottery stemless cup. Myrtle wreath on inside of concave offset lip. Outside, large handle palmette and to its left a warrior, named Iolaos, facing left, body frontal; he wear a chitoniskos and linen corselet, and has a himation draped over left arm, against which a spear nestles; his right leg appears to be raised.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
See also LIMC V, 464, Iolaos 58, and A. Lezzi-Hafter, Der Eretria-maler (Mainz 1988) no. 290, pl. 187a-b.
Bibliographic references: Hogarth, Lorimer & Edgar 1905 / Naukratis 1903 (p. 122, pl. VII, no. 6)
CVA Oxford I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain Fasc. 3, Oxford Fasc. 1 (pl. 14,25; 39,5; 43.13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1560)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
